ok, gonna ask my silly question here :ctwokinds-NoraEyebrows:
You've been cursed and you're becoming a character from the comic, but you can chose who you become
excluding Nora & the masks, who do you chose?
i couldn't decide between mike & sealeen so had to flip a coin, so i'm sealeen now i guess
i guess tom could just pick himself :ctwokinds-floraquestion:
I'd say either Eric or Trace. Basically the more bling the better.
wait, do we go into the comic world, or just transform into some character from the comic but still live in our universe?
this is what i forgot to specify when i originally asked it

I think I'd go with Karen or Maren honestly. If I had to BE one of them, honestly they seem like the best bet. Everyone else seems to get into dangerous situations and being the character, you don't know if you're gonna get out alive or what the story
they have fairly boring, but safe lives being in the tavern
If we go into the comic world after we transform then again, Eric or Trace. Kei is an option too, but only because it would make courting a certain dragoness easier.
Eric would be a good choice too.
If we'd transform and stay in this world then most likely Trace.
I dunno bout trace, he's got that whole evil past thing
plus the whole everyone wants to capture you or kill you.. or both
Idc, it wouldn't be him anymore
It'd be me transformed into him
yeah it would cuz you'd become him. xD
so for all intents and purposes, to anyone else, you would be trace
just cuz you're different on the inside, noone else could see that cept maybe nora.
there's a lot of assumptions here
Not really. That's a given for "becoming a character"
you are becoming them. They are not becoming you. xD
doesn't mean I loose my memories
of course, but noone else would know that
what you are privy to does not change the actions of others
Well, on the other hand If I became a comic character , my actions and the actions of those around me are determined by someone else.
It's kind of the same setup trace has in the story. To him, he was himself in someone else's body. People are still after him, trying to kill him or capture him
he's not the old trace, but that doesn't stop everyone else from acting on what the old trace did.
I feel picking a relatively safe character would be the best route.
Trace as a main character has some plot armor. Might not shield him from everything, but considering the stuff he went through I'd say he's a safe bet.
Also, lots of money, magic and knowledge.
I think plot armor is pretty bs, so I wouldn't rely on it. His money, magic, and knowledge are all absolutely things you could use to your advantage though.
As long as he's one of the main characters he's safe. Unless Tom sells the rights to G. R.R. Martin
then no character would be safe. ever
You seem to be under the assumption that main characters are immune to death, and that's just not the case.
That seems to be the case in most stories though.
Rely on that on your own peril. I've seen too damn many stoires where the main character is like "I'm the main character, I can't die!" and then they get ded'd.
it's so common, I wouldn't touch it.
The worst case of "Do you know who I am?!"
It happens, but not as often as you picture it. If some stories involve killing off a main character in a way that adds to the story or allows some other characters to grow then I'm all for it.
if you are that character, you wouldn't be all for it, now would you? :P
But still, being the main character is safer than being one from the sidelines
From everything I've seen, I'd highly disagree. The only time you're guaranteed not safe on the sidelines is if you're wearing a red shirt.
Or no shirt at all like musclehead general.
Maren, Karen, Eric, they're not main characters, but they're not redshirts.
they're 2ndary characters that have importance to the story
or wearing full body armor with a helmet, but you dare to talk back to alabaster
lol yeah they were pretty redshirt
oh, redshirt character is a phrase.
well that explains a lot xD
you seem to forget that english isn't my native language
yeah I'm sayin I wouldn't want to be main character in the heaps of danger unless the pros completely outweigh the cons.. and trace is not there yet imo
I still remember the confusion when I told ya guys I didn't know the meaning of the word 'elope'
but I wouldn't be a redshirt side character either
lol THings, I legit sometimes don't even remember you don't speak english primarily
So... Eric would be our best bet?
but honestly it's better than some ppl I speak to and they live here in the US and don't speak any other language
yeah I think eric would be pretty solid.
Since Maren and Karen did the tavern for a bit and had very little in the way of interaction with dramatic scenes or whatnot, the story doesn't focus on them enough to kill them off.
but focuses on them JUST enough to make them not work keeping alive..
Thank you for the praise. I'm only mentioning it cause there are things I'm still unaware of. 'Redshirt character' was one of those.
Well Karen is getting some valuable screen time
it's a goldilocks zone I feel. If you're too important, then bad shit will happen to you constantly.
I hope Maren will be involved in some shenanigans too
If you're not important, you can be killed off and noone will miss you.

so find the middleground where you're somewhat important, people will miss you if you're gone, but you're not important enough to the story that bad people consider you a threat, or even a target of opportunity
I think Eric, Maren, and Karen all fit that bill perfectly.
That reminds me of a sci fi book I read as a teen. Basically there was a dude and his wife and for some strange reason every other characters in the book started dieing off.
lool sounds pretty scary for the characters xD

It had started off slowly, but the closer you got tho the ending the more people died off. The book had an open ending, where the main character's wife lied on her deathbed and the main character begs you not to read the next page
I didn't flip that page and she's still alive.
yeah that kind of stuff is pretty uncommon.
Everything I see kills the unimportant side characters who mean nothing to the story.. or the main characters because they ARE important to the story.
I'll just.. yknow.. watch from the bleachers. :)
the book is called Nest of worlds, by M. Huberath.
In case you ever want to read it.
I can't believe you managed to resist turning that page
Well, my friend who gave me that book said he finished the book and he regrets finishing it
it mustve killed him at the end :OOO
One of the most unpleasant feelings is when you finish a story and there's nothing more.
